ticket.title: Js.erb templates broken in 2.3.0 RC1?
ticket.original-body:
js.erb templates seem to be broken in 2.3.0 RC1. Is this a known issue?
Controller (controllers/posts_controller.rb) @@@ def create … respond_to do |format| format.js end end @@@
View (views/posts/create.js.erb) @@@ javascript alert("the js.erb template is working!"); @@@
When I fire the Ajax.Request to /posts I don't get the js alert dialog specified in create.js.erb. I don't get any errors or warnings in the server log. But if I look at the ajax response (with Firebug) I'm basically getting back the whole html layout template...
ticket.latest-body:
js.erb templates seem to be broken in 2.3.0 RC1. Is this a known issue?
Controller (controllers/posts_controller.rb) @@@ def create … respond_to do |format| format.js end end @@@
View (views/posts/create.js.erb) @@@ javascript alert("the js.erb template is working!"); @@@
When I fire the Ajax.Request to /posts I don't get the js alert dialog specified in create.js.erb. I don't get any errors or warnings in the server log. But if I look at the ajax response (with Firebug) I'm basically getting back the whole html layout template...
ticket.original-body-html:
js.erb templates seem to be broken in 2.3.0 RC1. Is this a known issue?

Controller (controllers/posts_controller.rb)


def create
  …
  respond_to do |format|
    format.js
  end
end

View (views/posts/create.js.erb)


alert("the js.erb template is working!");

When I fire the Ajax.Request to /posts I don't get the js alert dialog specified in create.js.erb. I don't get any errors or warnings in the server log. But if I look at the ajax response (with Firebug) I'm basically getting back the whole html layout template...

version.body:
js.erb templates seem to be broken in 2.3.0 RC1. Is this a known issue?
Controller (controllers/posts_controller.rb) @@@ def create … respond_to do |format| format.js end end @@@
View (views/posts/create.js.erb) @@@ javascript alert("the js.erb template is working!"); @@@
When I fire the Ajax.Request to /posts I don't get the js alert dialog specified in create.js.erb. I don't get any errors or warnings in the server log. But if I look at the ajax response (with Firebug) I'm basically getting back the whole html layout template...
version.body-html:
js.erb templates seem to be broken in 2.3.0 RC1. Is this a known issue?

Controller (controllers/posts_controller.rb)


def create
  …
  respond_to do |format|
    format.js
  end
end

View (views/posts/create.js.erb)


alert("the js.erb template is working!");

When I fire the Ajax.Request to /posts I don't get the js alert dialog specified in create.js.erb. I don't get any errors or warnings in the server log. But if I look at the ajax response (with Firebug) I'm basically getting back the whole html layout template...
version.title: Js.erb templates broken in 2.3.0 RC1?

version.body: hmmm, some "evolutions": it seems to work if I specify render :layout => false : @@@ def create … respond_to do |format| format.js { render :layout => false } end end @@@
version.body-html:
hmmm, some "evolutions": it seems to work if I specify render :layout => false :


def create
  …
  respond_to do |format|
    format.js { render :layout => false }
  end
end
version.title: Js.erb templates broken in 2.3.0 RC1?

version.body: I believe this issue already came up and was fixed on master. If you could please try again on edge and let me know if your still having any problems.
version.body-html: I believe this issue already came up and was fixed on master. If you could please try again on edge and let me know if your still having any problems.
version.title: Js.erb templates broken in 2.3.0 RC1?

version.body:
Joshua, I'd like to try it on edge, but I can't even start mongrel with the latest revision (9702636a08e50e9fed9bf76ad620a6a0a109009e) because of a cookie_store/session error...
Apparently other users have the same issue (see Thibaud's comment here: #2001 )
version.body-html:
Joshua, I'd like to try it on edge, but I can't even start mongrel with the latest revision (9702636a08e50e9fed9bf76ad620a6a0a109009e) because of a cookie_store/session error...

Apparently other users have the same issue (see Thibaud's comment here: #2001 )
version.title: Js.erb templates broken in 2.3.0 RC1?

version.body: Sorry, that issue was just fixed. Please try once again.
version.body-html: Sorry, that issue was just fixed. Please try once again.
version.title: Js.erb templates broken in 2.3.0 RC1?

version.body:
Thanks Joshua,
I could finally test this issue (js.erb templates) with the latest edge revision, and yes, I confirm it has been fixed: js.erb templates are working great out-of-the-box
thanks z
version.body-html:
Thanks Joshua,

I could finally test this issue (js.erb templates) with the latest edge revision, and yes, I confirm it has been fixed: js.erb templates are working great out-of-the-box

thanks z
version.title: Js.erb templates broken in 2.3.0 RC1?

version.body: sorry if it is out of topic, but still, found out through those comments how to but, working currently with 2.3.4 rails version and jquery, had to put the render :layout => false in the format.js to make my .js.erb templates working (and took forever to get this page to be noticed... ;) ).
version.body-html:
sorry if it is out of topic,
but still, found out through those comments how to but,
working currently with 2.3.4 rails version and jquery,
had to put the render :layout => false in the format.js
to make my .js.erb templates working (and took forever to get this page to be noticed... ;) ).
version.title: Js.erb templates broken in 2.3.0 RC1?
